DOC.detailed_description: The purpose pilot study evaluate efficacy intervention reduce sexual risk behavior enhance HIV-preventive behavior among female sex worker ( FSWs ) Yerevan , Armenia . The study design randomize control trial 120 FSWs age 18 recruit Hope Help NGO . Participants complete interviewer administer questionnaire collect baseline , 3- 6-month follow-up . Subsequently , participant randomly assign either intervention condition wait-list control . Those randomize intervention condition receive 2-hour one-on-one intervention session emphasize HIV knowledge , self-efficacy , condom use behavior . They also receive 10-15 minute booster session 3-month follow-up . The comparison condition wait-listed , choice participate intervention program upon completion study . The main outcome measure include consistent condom use , define condom use every episode vaginal intercourse client . Other outcome measure condom application FSW HIV- preventive behavior condom use self-efficacy , knowledge HIV transmission dynamic , perceive barrier condom use condom use error . Results pilot study expect inform large trial implement FSWs Armenia , effort devise gender culturally relevant intervention program prevent HIV transmission vulnerable population .
